data.text:
“Hot Coffee” Documentary Guide

Directions: First, review the Terms to Know section to understand concepts this film will address. Then, answer the questions in each section as you view the film.

Terms to Know  Punitive damages: damages exceeding simple compensation and awarded to punish the defendant; purpose is to change behavior of the wrongdoer.

 Tort Reform: refers to laws passed on a state-by-state basis which place limits or caps on the type or amount of damages that may be awarded in personal injury lawsuits.

 Caps on damages: refers to a law that limits the amount a jury can award for damages regardless of the facts of the case.

 Mandatory arbitration: a process by which parties “agree” to have a third party arbitrator (single arbitrator or a panel), instead of a jury or judge, resolve a dispute.

 Arbitration clause: clause in a contract that requires the parties to resolve their disputes through an arbitration process.

Answer the following questions as you view the documentary.

Exhibit 1: The Public Relations Campaign

The family of Stella Liebeck explains that there are many people with a “distorted view” of this case. Identify at least one major misconception the public has had about what they think they know about “hot coffee” lawsuit with Stella Liebeck vs. McDonalds.

She was trying to drink the coffee while driving: She was holding the coffee between her legs

Summarize the coffee burn incident that occurred with Stella Liebeck.

Stella was actually in the passenger seat and her nephew was the one driving. She put the coffee cup between her legs in order to put the cream and sugar, then spilled it

McDonald’s first offered $_________800 on what was initially a $__________10, medical problem.

According to their manual, what was the holding temperature supposed to be for the McDonald’s water?: 180-190____________________ degrees

The Stella Liebeck vs. McDonald’s trial revealed that McDonald’s had over 700 __________ previous complaints about burns from hot beverages.

In what percentages did the jury assign blame in the hot coffee lawsuit against McDonalds?

Liebeck: 20_____%

McDonalds: 80_____%

The jury awarded Mrs. Liebeck $160,000 in compensatory damages and $2____ million in punitive damages.

The punitive damage award was reduced to $________________480,

According to the documentary, tort reform is intended to _____________limit the likelihood that you can bring a lawsuit.

Briefly explain some of the lawsuits mentioned which were distorted when reported/spoken about by the media.

Man using public telephone booth, hit by drunk driver but sued the telephone company because he could not get out.

How does the documentary portray former President Bush?

This documentary portray the former President as a manipulator which is not a good impression to the public

Colin suffer severe brain damage due to the lack of oxygen. According to the hospitals standard of care, he experienced oxygen depletion for 5-8 minutes which resulted in the damages

After a three week trial, the jury found that Dr. Knolla’s negligence caused Colin’s brain injury and awarded the Gourley’s $_________5 million in damages.

The jury did not know that the law in Nebraska capped all damages. The verdict was reduced to $_________1 million.

What is the difference between economic and non-economic damages?

Economic damages are out of pocket costs -health care, lost wages while Non- economic damages are the emotional cost pain, lost of enjoyment of live

What state is used as an example to show the ‘myth’ of health care costs? Texas is used as an example to show the ‘myth’ of health care costs
